Body:
The sandhi phenomenon known as liaison in French bears a strong social connotation, that is to say when its realisation is facultative, it is a marker of a high social class.

Are there facultative phenomenons that bears no social connotation?
Title: Is it usual for facultative phenomenons to be socially connoted?

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Fourth year student in Mathematics and Linguistics, particularly in statistical NLP. Interested in NLP, Indo-european languages and especially the Celtic group.

Native French speaker, routine offender of English, studied German and Breton.

Moderator pro tempore for french.stackexchange.
